definition: a funeral/to encoffin a corpse/to carry to burial

sentences.english: The profession of funeral and interment is a special service trade.
sentences.chinese: 殯葬行業是一個特殊的服務行業。

sentences.english: They really challenge the traditional notions of what a funeral is.
sentences.chinese: 他們確實能夠挑戰傳統殯葬觀念。

sentences.english: So Mrs. Li trusted the undertakers to take care of the funeral.
sentences.chinese: 所以李太太相信殯葬者，讓他們處理喪禮。

sentences.english: The rest was for the ceremony and undertakers' fees.
sentences.chinese: 其餘的就是喪禮和殯葬者的費用。

sentences.english: With mirth in funeral and with dirge in marriage.
sentences.chinese: 殯葬帶有歡樂而結婚奏唱悼歌。

sentences.english: It will be the first time the funeral industry has sought to recruit college students.
sentences.chinese: 這是上海殯葬業崗位首次集體向大學生開放。

sentences.english: Nowadays, great changes have taken place in regard to funerals and interment.
sentences.chinese: 現在，殯葬方式有了很大改變。

sentences.english: To formulate guidelines and policies on funeral and interment, push forward related reforms;
sentences.chinese: 擬定殯葬工作方針政策，推行殯葬改革。

sentences.english: To formulate guidelines and policies on funeral and interment, push forward related reforms;
sentences.chinese: 擬定殯葬工作方針政策，推行殯葬改革。

sentences.english: Article 3 The department of civil affairs under the State Council shall be responsible for funeral and interment control throughout the country.
sentences.chinese: 第三條國務院民政部門負責全國的殯葬管理工作。

sentences.english: The undertaker closed his eyes for a moment and then began to speak.
sentences.chinese: 殯葬者閉了一會兒他的眼睛，然後開始說。

sentences.english: Wooden or earthen figures of men and women buried with the dead.
sentences.chinese: 古代殯葬用的木製或陶製的偶人。

sentences.english: Funerary euphemism is an important component of it.
sentences.chinese: 殯葬雅語是一個主要組分它。

sentences.english: Oliver had been sojourning at the undertaker's some three weeks or a month.
sentences.chinese: 奧利弗在殯葬承辦人那裏住了有個把月。

definition: to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911
Kangle county in Linxia Hui autonomous prefecture 臨夏回族自治州|临夏回族自治州[Lin2 xia4 Hui2 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Gansu
to try hard to/to strive to
to nibble away at (as silkworm consume leaves)/fig. to embezzle progressively
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
